H. Bernstein and Co. Mobile, AL, Letter from H. Bernstein and Co., regarding a rush order request of footwear from West Auburn Maine Company
Hamburger, I. and Ertheiler, Philip. Philadelphia, PA, I. Hamburger and Co. note payable
Hamburger, I. New York, NY, Letter from I. Hamburger and Co. to an attorney requesting information on various outstanding accounts
Hamilton, Paul. Philadelphia, PA, Letter regarding payment from Paul Hamilton
Harby, C. J. and Harby, Isaac R. Greenville, FL, Letter requesting the trustee for Leah Cohen to transfer two shares of South Western Railroad, Georgia as per the terms of the marriage agreement

Harby, Isaac and Cohen, E. P. Charleston, SC, Important letter from Isaac Harby in Charleston, South Carolina to E. P. Cohen. The letter presents historical argument for not wearing a head covering in the temple. This is the earliest known American document in the history of Reform Judaism were one of the earliest proponents is conducting his own research and interpretations of scripture as to whether the wearing of a head covering is required

Harris, Joseph to Davis, Jefferson. Sumterville, SC, Letter, written by Joseph Harris, dated January 30th, 1862 from Summerville, South Carolina, asking Jefferson Davis to endorse the forced resignation of Captain J.T. Montgomery. Jefferson Davis' autograph note is signed on the verso of the letter, as Confederate President, dated February 5th, 1862 and also includes an autograph note signed by Secretary of War Judah Benjamin, dated February 6th, 1862
Harseim, R. G. Indianapolis, IN, Signed letter from R.G. Harseim regarding a cloth order

Hart, Abraham and Morais, Sabato. Philadelphia, PA, Broadside and letter from Abraham Hart, the Parnis of Mikveh Israel Synagogue to Rabbi Sabato Morais (1823-1897) of Mikveh Israel Synagogue in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. In this stampless cover letter he is answering Morais' request for $300 for the poor. Hart refers him to the enclosed Broadside resolution of the Board of Mikveh Israel granting the request

Hart, Abraham and Solis, Solomon. Philadelphia, PA, Signed letter from Abraham Hart, president of the Jewish Publication Society of Philadelphia (first of its type in U.S.) at the time, to Solomon Solis of Philadelphia, a member of the Pub. Committee of the Society at the time
Hart, Abraham. Philadelphia, PA, Letter with commercial content from A. Hart, president of Mikveh Israel
Hart, David. New Orleans, LA, Signed business letter to G.W. Johnson and Co. sent care of Judah Touro by David Hart
Hart, David. New Orleans, LA, Signed business letter to G.W. Johnson and Co. sent care of Judah Touro by David Hart. It includes a detailed account of what Hart had sold for Johnson
Hart, David. New Orleans, LA, Signed business letter to G.W. Johnson and Co. sent care of Judah Touro by David Hart. It includes a detailed account of what Hart had sold for Johnson
Hart, Eli. New York, NY, Letter written to Eli Hart from Montreal regarding a legal claim

Hart, Isaac and Abrams, A. New Orleans, LA, Letter is to Isaac Hart ((1814 - 1890) announcing his appointment by the Board of Officers (Shangarai Chasset - Gates of Mercy, New Orleans) to be on the reception for the guests at the Consecration of their first permanent building, to take place on Wednesday, the first day of April

Hayes, Isaac Israel. Boston, MA, Letter to Dr. Isaac Israel Hayes, a surgeon in the second Grinnel arctic expedition, from David McConky in West Chester, PA, thanking him for a copy of his book (probably "An arctic boat journey")
Hayes, Isaac Israel. Philadelphia, PA, Note on Continental Hotel stationary, signed by Dr. Isaac Israel Hayes, arctic explorer and surgeon
Hays, Isaac. Philadelphia, PA, Letter to Dr. Isaac Hays from Wilmer Worthington in West Chester, PA, asking that Dr. Hays look at his daughter Kate's eyes during her visit to the city
Hays, Isaac. Philadelphia, PA, Letter written by Dr. Isaac Hays, editor of the American Journal of Medicine, to Dr. B.R. Wellford, president of the American Medical Society

Hays, Isaac. Philadelphia, PA, Letter written by Henry Hays to his young sister, Sarah Ann Hays. This letter concerns personal matters and a wonderful travelogue of his steam boat trip to Sarasota Spring
Hays, Judah. Boston, MA, Letter by Judah Hays to a captain of his ship unlawfully detained in a French port for ransom
Hays, Mariam Gratz and Gratz, Rebecca. Bordertown, NJ, Letter to Rebecca Gratz in Philadelphia, PA from Mariam Gratz Hays, Rebecca's niece from Bordertown, NJ
Hays, Mariam Gratz and Minis, Sarah Ann. Philadelphia, PA, Letter to Sarah Ann Minis in Savannah, Georgia from Mariam Gratz Hays in Philadelphia, PA
Hays, Moses Michael. Boston, MA, Signed business letter from Moses Michael Hays in Boston, MA
Hays, Moses Michael. New York, NY, Signed business letter from Moses Michael Hays in Boston, MA
Hays, Moses Michael. New York, NY, Signed Colonial-era letter by Moses M. Hays fully in his hand. It was written in New York City and relates to business
Hays, Richea Gratz and Gratz, Rebbeca. Lancaster, PA, Letter from Richea Gratz Hays, the first American Jewess to attend college, to her sister, Rebecca Gratz

Hays, Sarah Ann Minis and Etting, Richa Gratz. Philadelphia, PA, Letter from Sarah Ann Minis Hays to her mother-in-law Richa Gratz Hays, concerning family matters. Includes scribbled notes from Frank and Henrietta Hays to their grandmother
Hays, Sarah Ann Minis and Hays, Isaac. Washington, DC, Letter from Srah Ann Minis Hays to her husband Dr. Isaac Hays, concerning personal matters and their children

did.unittitle: Hays, Sarah Ann Minis. Philadelphia, PA, Letter from Richea Gratz Hays and Ellen Hays, both in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania to Sarah Ann Hays in Lexington, Kentucky, reporting the death of Reyna Hays and discussing various family matters and visitors

Hays, Sarah Ann Minis. Savannah, GA, Letter from Divina Cohen Minis and Phillipa Minis in Savannah, Georgia to Sarah Ann Minis Hays. The letter is replete in personal matters and also mentions Captain Uriah P. Levy
Hays, Sarah Ann. Philadelphia, PA, Letter from Elanor Carlile of Lexington, Kentucky to Sarah Ann Hays. The letter si replete in personal matters and gossip
Hecht, Israel. Philadelphia, PA, Letter from Israel Hecht to Byerly Hart Esq
Hecht, L. and Hecht, S. Pocahontas, AR, Personal letter written by a clerk of Hecht and Nicklase, dry goods, boots, shoes, groceries, and general merchandise, on Christmas Eve
Hecht. San Francisco, CA, Letter from Buckingham and Hecht to Frank Litsch

Heilprin, Angelo. Philadelphia, PA, Letter on the stationary of the Academy of Natural Sciences, Philadelphia, written by Angelo Heilprin (Curator in charge of the museum of that institution) to C. B. Norton. The entire letter contains detailed observations and advice to Norton on a proposed exhibition of American Art in London
Heineman, L. and Schlesinger, Joseph. Bradford, PA, Business letter from Joseph Schlesinger, successor to L. Heineman
Hellman, M. and Cahn, A. Omaha, NE, Letterhead from Hellman and Cahn sent to W. A. Carter in Fort Bridge, Wyoming
Hendricks & Brothers. New York, NY, Business letter from Liverpool, England to Hendricks and Brothers, the major copper importer in the United States
Hendricks & Brothers. New York, NY, Business letter from Liverpool, England to Hendricks and Brothers, the major copper importer in the United States
Hendricks & Brothers. New York, NY, Business letter from Liverpool, England to Hendricks and Brothers, the major copper importer in the United States
Hendricks & Brothers. New York, NY, Business letter from Liverpool, England to Hendricks and Brothers, the major copper importer in the United States

Hendricks & Brothers. New York, NY, Letter sent by Ridge, Rayburn and Co. from St. Louis to the firm of Hendricks and Brothers in New York. The brief note inside refers to an invoice for copper on the ship Huntsville
Hendricks, Harmon. New York, NY, Stampless letter from Hartford to Harmon Hendricks about a debt
Hendricks, Harmon. New York, NY, Stampless letter from Liverpool, England to Harmon Hendricks with invoice
Hendricks, Uriah and Costiga, John. Schnectady, NY, Letter regarding payments
Henry Solomon & Son. Savannah, GA, Letter to Urbana Wine Company from Henry Solomon
Henry Solomon & Son. Savannah, GA, Letter to Urbana Wine Company from Henry Solomon
Henry Solomon & Son and Solomon, A. P. Savannah, GA, Letter regarding the receipt of monies on the stationary of Henry Solomon's store
Henry Solomon & Son and Solomon, A. P. Savannah, GA, Letter to Urbana Wine Company from Henry Solomon with logo of Union Steam Mills Co
Henry Solomon & Son and Solomon, A. P. Savannah, GA, Letter to Urbana Wine Company from Henry Solomon with logo of Union Steam Mills Co
Hirschfeld, Louis. Pittsburgh, PA, Signed letter from Louis Hirschfeld to Jacobs and Meyes Co., in Philadelphia. Text mostly in German and a little English
Hoffmann, A. J. Cripple Creek, CO, Business letter land for tunnel site
Holritz & Anderson. Sius, DK, Letter from Fred Holritz

Hutzler, Ruby and Hutzler, Moses. Richmond, VA, Letter sent under "Flag of Truce" from Richmond, Virginia via Fortress Monroe to New York City and post marked "Old Point Comfort". Ruby writes a letter to her brother in New York City filled with family matter and hopes for peace

did.unittitle: Irvine. Philadelphia, PA, Business letter
Isaac, Gustav and Dropsie, Moses. New York, NY, Business letter from Gustav Isaac of Stern, Jonas, and Co. to Moses Dropsie
Isaacs, Harriet Maria. Newburgh, NY, Letter written to Harriet Maria Isaacs from New York City by a personal friend
Isaacs, Isaac A. Cleveland, OH, Illustrated letterhead signed by Isaac A. Isaacs, Union Hall, Cleveland, Ohio
Isaacs, Isaac A. Cleveland, OH, Letter from Isaac A. Isaacs to Singer Sewing Machine regarding a dispute
Isaacs, Isaac A. Cleveland, OH, Letter from Isaac A. Isaacs to Singer Sewing Machine regarding an order of two machines and enclosing a draft for $100

Isaacs, Myer S. New York, NY, Printed letter from the "Board of Delegates of American Israelites" from Myer S. Isaacs to various presidents of congregations asking (for a second time) for the names of delegates and other information

Isaacson, M. and Tobias, J. I. Philadelphia, PA, Letter from M. Isaacson in Philadelphia to J.I. Tobias in New York, New York relating that he has just closed his fur business and is now in search of work as a fur manufacturer or merchant but will take work as a clerk, bookkeeper or salesman
Israel, Fielder. Baltimore, MD, Letter ro Fielder Israel from Richard henderson in Leesburg, Virginia, remitting the money owed to Isaac Burnistin
Israel, Israel. Philadelphia, PA, Letter to "Israel Israel" R. W. Master of Grand Lodge, Pennsylvania from Brother Samuel Townsend reflecting on his expulsion by Lodge #75, Pennsylvania
Israel, Samuel. Mount Vernon, OH, Letter with legal content
Israel. , Letter informing Israel that the author is prepared for his family's visit
J. H. & S. Riker. New York, NY, Pursuit of money owed Solomon Rich
Jacob Leonard. Albany, NY, Letter to George W. Whitbeck
Jacob Leonard. Albany, NY, Letter to George W. Whitbeck
Jacob Leonard. Albany, NY, Letter to George W. Whitbeck
Jacob Leonard. Albany, NY, Letter to George W. Whitbeck
Jacob Leonard. Albany, NY, Letter to George W. Whitbeck
Jacob and Meyer. New York, NY, Letter to Jacob and Meyer in Philadelphia, signed by Marx and Jacob I. Seixas in New York City
Jacobs, J. B. Philadelphia, PA, Signed letter from J.B. Jacobs and Co. to Jacobs and Mayer in Philadelphia, regarding business matters. In English and German
Jacobs, Joseph. Philadelphia, PA, Letter from Joseph Jacobs to Jacobs, Myers and Co., in Philadelphia, PA
Jacobs, L. M. and Zeckendorf Bro. Tucson, AZ, Romero and Bro. letterhead and letter from Las Vegas, NM to L. M. Jacobs and Co. in Tuscon, AZ
Jacobs, M. and Goodman, H. Phoenix, AZ, Letter from M. Jacobs and Co., dealers in general merchandise in Phoenic, AZ to Peoria, AZ concerning a shipment of corn meal
Jacobs. Salem School, SC, Letter from an A.F. Brugess at the start of the Civil War from South Carolina. Mentions a Jew named Jacobs

Janison, Samuel and Levy, Louis E. Savannah, GA, Letter from S. Janison of Savannah to Louis E. Levy in Philadelphia, as president of the Jewish Immigration Society. In the letter, Janison offers to sell lands in Georgia for a Jewish farming colony
Joachimsen, Priscilla J. New York, NY, Letter from Priscilla J. Joachimsen, president of the Hebrew Sheltering Guardian Society, certifying that the number of children exceeds the nuber of beds

Johnson, Augustus and Clark, James H. Beirut, Syria, Letter on the official stationary of the Consulate of the United States for Syria and Palestine by the consul, Augustus Johnson, with a great vingete of the American eagle
Jonas, J. Chicago, IL, Signed commercial letterhead from the J. Jonas and Co., wholesale dealers in hides, furs, wool pelts, tallow and rags
Jonas, Joseph. Cincinnati, OH, Signed letter by Joseph Jonas (1792-1869) inviting Allan G. Thurman of Chillicothe to address the Democratic Republican citizens of Cincinnati
Joseph, Henry. Montreal, Letter signed by Rachel addressed to Henry

did.unittitle: Joseph, M. and Wolfson, D. Columbus, GA, Signed letter from D. Wolfson to M. Joseph, dry goods and notions, regarding a claim by Kahn and Schloss that he is representing

Joseph, Nathan and Levy, Henry. San Francisco, CA, A group of three letters from a San Francisco fishing equipment dealer to Hall Fishing Line Co. of Central Valley, NY. This is an early correspondence from Nathan Joseph, who we suppose may have been a dealer in fishing equipment etc. to the Hall Fishing Line Co., requesting various styles of lines including oil silk line, hard braided linen, etc
Joseph, Nathan and Levy, Henry. San Francisco, CA, Group of three letters from a San Francisco fishing equipment dealer to Hall Fishing Line of Central Valley
Joseph, Nathan. San Francisco, CA, Letter between fishing businesses

Josephs, Samuel and Dropsie, Moses. Harrisburg, PA, Letter from Jewish legislator, Samuel Josephs of Philadelphia to his personal friend Moses Aaron Dropsie, a noted Philadelphia lawter, college president and Jewish communal leader
Judah, Benjamin. New York, NY, Letter written by Michigan Price to Charles Ludlow, in which he notes meeting Mr. Judah, brother of Benjamin
Judah, David and Pollock, Edward. Richmond, VA, Letter from David Judah to Edward Pollock, relating to commerce between the two, and written as close associates
Judah, David and Pollock, Edward. Richmond, VA, Letter from David Judah to Edward Pollock, relating to commerce between the two, and written as close associates
Judah, David and Pollock, Edward. Richmond, VA, Letter from David Judah to Edward Pollock, relating to commerce between the two, and written as close associates
Judah, David and Tobias, T. I. Richmond, VA, Letter relating to commerce between David Judah and T.I. Tobias
Judah, David. Richmond, VA, Letter regarding payment
Judah, Jonathan. New York, NY, Letter regarding construction of a new building
Kahn, Felix, Letter with two cloth samples, an order form and a return envelope

did.unittitle: Katz, Herman. New York, NY, Signed letter from Herman Katz offering buttons
Katz and Barnett. New Orleans, LA, Letter from Katz and Barnett for an order of 1,0000 pounds of thread

Kaufman, C. Charleston, SC, Hand written letter from C. Kaufman to G. Boutwell, Secretary of the Treasury of the United States, asking for a copy of instructions in relation to the public debt and accounts
Kaufman, L. Rochester, NY, Letter from L. Kaufamn to Urbana Wine Company
Keats, John. Philadelphia, PA, Partial translation of John Keats' Fairy Song
Kellogg, A. and Hoffmann, W. T. Cripple Creek, CO, Business letter discussing financial matters and a man they have been unable to locate
Kellogg, A. and Hoffmann, W. T. Cripple Creek, CO, Business letter discussing land to purchase
Kellogg, A. and Hoffmann, W. T. Cripple Creek, CO, Business letter discussing land to purchase
Kellogg, A. and Hoffmann, W. T. Cripple Creek, CO, Business letter discussing land to purchase
Kellogg, A. and Hoffmann, W. T. Cripple Creek, CO, Business letter discussing mining and tunnel construction
Kellogg, A. and Hoffmann, W. T. Cripple Creek, CO, Business letter discussing proposals for Chicago
Kellogg, A. Cripple Creek, CO, Letter requesting a shipment of supplies from Kellogg's office
Kellogg, A. Victor, CO, Letter introducing a business partner
Kellogg, John M. and Rose, Reuben M. New York, NY, Letter from sewing machine manufacturer
