did.unittitle: Kiesel, Fred J. Ogden, UT, Letter from Fred J. Kiesel, wholesale dealers in groceries, liquor, tobacco and cigars to Fort Bridges, Wyoming on billhead
Klein, L. W. , Letter discussing synagogue accounts
Klein, Louis W. Keokuk, IA, Letter of interest in synagogue membership
Klein, Louis W. Keokuk, IA, Letter of interest in synagogue membership
Kohn, M. and Dropsie, Moses. New York, NY, Business letter from Kohn and Leberman to Moses Dropsie
Kohn, M. and Dropsie, Moses. Philadelphia, PA, Letter regarding payment
Kraus, Charles and Kraus, Solomon. Wheeling, WV, Letter from C. Kraus, Successor to Henry Schmulbach regarding a shipment of wine received from Pleasant Valley Wines
Kursheedt, Alexander. New York, NY, Signed business letter from Alexander Kursheedt (1811-1884)

Kursheedt, Gershom and Montefiore, Moses. Philadelphia, PA, This letter is a period copy from Moses Monifiore to Gershom Kursheedt and Solomon Isaacs in New York, thanking the Congregations for donating 64 Pound Sterling to "our poor brethren in the Holy Land". He notes that the Distribution Committee in Amsterdam will handle sending the funds to the needy. On the verso of the letter is a note to the editor, asking that the letter be published. it was then copied and sent to Isaac Leeser for publication in the Occident

Lauer, Ignatius and Putzel, S. G. Baltimore, MD, Invitation and letter from Ignatius Lauer and S.G. Putzel, the Secretary and President respectively of the Baltimore United Hebrew Assistance Society. It is an invitation to attend the annual festival held on Thanksgiving Day,1854 for the aid of fellow Hebrews

Lazarus, Michael. Charleston, SC, A one page letter signed by Michael Lazarus and written to C.P. Relf, a noted Pennsylvania agriculturalist concerning the cotton and rice trade, quoting bid and ask market prices for both commodities, and speculating on the future price of cotton. Written during the Antebellum slave period in Charleston, South Carolina

Lazarus, Michael. Charleston, SC, Signed letter to S. Hutckins in Providence, Rhode Island from Michael Lazarus regarding the sale of cotton to Hitckins. Lazarus expresses his disappointment and that he has made no profit on the sale

Lazarus, Rachel Mordecai and Mordecai, Emma. Wilmington, NC, One page stampless letter from Rachel Mordecai Lazarus (1788-1838) of Wilmington, North Carolina to Emma Mordecai of Richmond, Virginia. It discusses family events and daily life

Leberman, L. Philadelphia, PA, Printed letter from J. Solis Cohen and Mayer Sulzberger inviting the recipient to a meeting in Moses Dropsie's office at 29 South 6th St., with the purpose of founding a college of education of the youth for Jewish ministry. The president of the meeting is to pick two members from each Jewish congregation for fundraising at their respective congregations
Leebes, S. and Edinger, M. B. Salt Lake City, UT, Letter noting that merchandise will be delivered, signed by M.B. Edinger for S. Leebes and Co
Leebes, S. and Edinger, M. B. San Francisco, CA, Printed letter informing the recipient that Mr. Edinger will be visiting for a sales call
Leebes, S. San Francisco, CA, Business letter from S. Leebes to Fort Bridges, Wyoming, sending some speciments of Chinese coins

Leeser, Isaac and A. Bloch. Cincinnati, OH, Three page letter from A. Bloch, brother of Edward Bloch (1816-1881) in Cincinnati, Ohio to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia. It is highly personal, dealing with the state of family health and the sorrow of being away from his mother and friends in Bohemia
Leeser, Isaac and Abelson, Simon. Philadelphia, PA, Letter from Simon Abelson to Isaac Leeser, asking to replace an ad for A. Myers and Raphael Heile

Leeser, Isaac and Abraham, Joseph. Cincinnati, OH, Three page letter from Joseph Abraham in Cincinnati, Ohio to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. This letter gives a rare personal insight into the ongoing Wise reform controversy

Leeser, Isaac and Abraham, Joseph. Cincinnati, OH, Two page letter from Louis Abraham in Cincinnati, Ohio to Isaac Leeser, in which Abraham announces that he is the only Jewish lawyer in Ohio. Ha also brings Leeser up to date on Jewish happenings in Cincinnati

Leeser, Isaac and Abraham, Joseph. Cinncinati, OH, Three page letter from Joseph Abraham in Cincinnati, Ohio to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, in which he relates news on the late dedication of a "progressive Jewish temple" in Cincinnati. He goes on to rail against Reform and the concept that "rationalism is to govern against the words of inspiration."
Leeser, Isaac and Abraham, Lewis. Cincinnati, OH, One page letter from Lewis Abraham in Cincinnati to Isaac Leeser about Occident business

Leeser, Isaac and Abraham, Lewis. Cinncinati, OH, Letter from Lewis Abraham in Cincinnati, in which he addresses a serious question to Isaac Leeser regarding the various synagogue practices in the United States on charging for seats and seat ownership
Leeser, Isaac and Allen, Henry S. Philadelphia, PA, Signed letter from Henry S. Allen to Isaac Leeser, thanking him for the free ad for their 7th anniversary ball
Leeser, Isaac and An Impartial Observer. Philadelphia, PA, Letter to Isaac Leeser calling for Jews to unite

Leeser, Isaac and Auerbach, Henry. St. Louis, MO, Letter from Henry Auerbach, Secretary of the United Hewbrew Congregation in St. Louis to Isaac leeser, asking about the qualification of Henry Vidaver, who was previously the Rabbi of Rodeph Shalom in Philadelphia, PA
Leeser, Isaac and Baland, Charles. Near Hartland, WI, Stampless letter from Charles Baland to Isaac Leeser ordering several Occidents and noting that he will order more if circumstances permit

Leeser, Isaac and Benjamin, Israel Joseph. Cincinnati, OH, Letter fragment from Benjamin II (Israel Joseph Benjamin) to Isaac Leeser. It is a rebuttal to attacks in the press by J. K. Gutheim, the preacher and chazzan of the Portuguese synagogue in New Orleans, regarding the Touro Monument Affair

Leeser, Isaac and Bernal, A. I. H. Louisville, KY, Letter from A.I.H Bernal, the teacher at Congregation K.K. Adas Israel in Louisville, Kentucky to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia. This is a detailed account of the difficulties he is having running the Sabbath School because of the interference of A. Gerstle, a lay leader in K.K Adas Israel

Leeser, Isaac and Bernal, A. I. H. Louisville, KY, Letter from A.I.H Bernal, the teacher at Congregation K.K. Adas Israel in Louisville, Kentucky to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia. This is a detailed first hand account of Rabbi Isaac Wise's visit to Louisville
Leeser, Isaac and Bimusles, Evelyn. Philadelphia, PA, A signed report of the Hewbrew Ladies Sewing Society, detailing their the society's activities
Leeser, Isaac and Bloch, A. Baltimore, MD, Personal letter from Mrs. A. Bloch in Baltimore to Isaac Leeser, in which she expresses her regret at not hearing from Leeser

Leeser, Isaac and Block, E. New York, NY, A detailed four page letter from E. (Eleazer) Block in New York City to Rev. Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia. The letter includes a rare description of the failed attempt to develop a "Classical School" for Jewish children in New York City. Block also discusses his family affairs
Leeser, Isaac and Bloomingdale, S. Franklin, PA, Note from S. Bloomingdale inviting Isaac Leeser to a ball
Leeser, Isaac and Bomeisler, Evelyn. Philadelphia, PA, Announcement of the annual meeting of the Jewish Foster Home
Leeser, Isaac and Bomeisler, Evelyn. Philadelphia, PA, Announcement of the annual meeting of the Jewish Foster Home
Leeser, Isaac and Bomeisler, Evelyn. Philadelphia, PA, Minutes of the annual meeting of the Jewish Foster Home

Leeser, Isaac and Bomeisler, Evelyn. Philadelphia, PA, One letter and three printed invitations from Evelyn Bomeisler to Isaac Leeser. The letter includes four pages of the complete hand written minutes of the 8th annual meeting of the Jewish Foster Home Society of Philadelphia. The three printed invitations are to the annual meeting of the Jewish Foster Home Society of Philadelphia

Leeser, Isaac and Brandon, Joseph. New York, NY, Letter from Joseph Brandon in New York City to Isaac Leeser. Brandon is returing the ticket to the Education Society dinner, as he will not be able to attend
Leeser, Isaac and Bruce, Samuel L. Cincinnati, OH, Letter from Samuel L. Bruce in Cincinnati to Isaac Leeser, in which Bruce launches into a diatribe against the Reform Movement in Cincinnati

Leeser, Isaac and Bruel, L. E. Cincinnati, OH, Letter from L. E. Bruel in Cincinnati to Isaac Leeser, in which Bruel informs him of the death of his father Samuel Bruel, an early and active member of the Cincinnati Jewish community. The letter also includes an obituary from a Cincinnati newspaper

Leeser, Isaac and Bush, Isidor. New York, NY, Letter from Isadore Bush (Busch) in New York City to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia, in which Bush apologizes to Leeser for starting the first Jewish weekly in the United States, Israel's Herald, and explains that it will not compete with the Occident. The letter is in German with an English translation

Leeser, Isaac and Bush, Isidor. St. Louis, MO, Letter from Isadore Bush (1822-1898) in St. Louis, Missouri to Isaac Leeser, in which Bush conveys his views on the state of Judaism, and takes Leeser to task for some of his views

Leeser, Isaac and Bush, Isidor. St. Louis, MO, Letter from Isidor Bush in St. Louis, Missouri to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, in which Bush asks Leeser to look over an article. In German with an English translation

Leeser, Isaac and Bush, Isidor. St. Louis, MO, Letter from Isidor Bush in St. Louis, Missouri to Rev. Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, in which Bush asks that Leeser reinstate his Occident subscription and accept a demand notice that he was cheated on, since Leeser knows the man

scopecontent.p: LSKAP0103_1r.tif; LSKAP0103_1v.tif; LSKAP0103_2_1r.tif; LSKAP0103_2_2r.tif; LSKAP0103_2_3r.tif; LSKAP0103_2_4r.tif

did.unittitle: Leeser, Isaac and C., J. Chicago, IL, Letter from J.C. of Chicago, Illinois to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia, in which J.C. requests the dedication of the new cemetery of Kehilah Anshe Mayrif in Chicago, with related German attached news clipping from the Deborah, to be inserted in the Occident

Leeser, Isaac and Carr, L. Columbia, SC, Letter from Isaac Mayer Wise in Cincinnati to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia, in which Wise lauds the success of his newly published Israelite. He also includes a copy of the publication. Letter from L. Carr in Columbia, South Carolina to Rev. Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. It is a fine account of a smaller Southern community's struggle to re-establish Orthodox Judaism after the ravages of the Civil War

Leeser, Isaac and Caruahan, D. J. Pottsville, PA, Letter from D.J. Caruahan, a Presbyterian minister, to Isaac Leeser, in which Caruahan thanks Leeser for supplying answers to his questions and promises to visit in November. He also gives Leeser encouragement upon hearing that he was fired by Mikveh Israel

Leeser, Isaac and Carvahlo, David Nunes. New Orleans, LA, An early Reconstruction era letter from D. Carvalho (1848-1925) in New Orleans to Rev. Isaac Leeser. Carvalho writea a somewhat angry business letter about books

Leeser, Isaac and Carvalho, S. N. Charleston, SC, Letter to Rabbi Isaac Lesser (1806-1868) from the well know communal leader and public figure Solomon Nunes Carvalho (1815-1897). In this letter he speaks to an interpretation on Maimonides in an article that was proposed for publication in the Occident. Additionally he opines on other scholarly articles that were sent to Leeser

Leeser, Isaac and Carvalho, Solomon Nunes. Charleston, SC, Four page letter from Solomon Nunes Carvalho in Charleston, South Carolina to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, in which Carvalho discusses the heated public argument that Leeser had with Rev. Solomon Jacobs in Charleston. Carvalho lays out a detailed "tactical" plan by which Leeser should respond to Jacobs without provoking him

Leeser, Isaac and Carvalho, Solomon Nunes. Charleston, SC, Letter from Solomon Nunes Carvalho (1815-1897) in Charleston, South Carolina to Rev. Isaac Leeser (1806-1868) in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. In this letter Carvalho relays a book order and describes the great pain that he has suffered because of a boil, apologizing for not writing due to his incapacitation

Leeser, Isaac and Carvalho, Solomon Nunes. Charleston, SC, Letter from Solomon Nunes Carvalho (1815-1897) in Charleston, South Carolina to Rev. Isaac Lesser (1806-1868) in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. In this four page letter, Carvalho tries to sooth Leeser's bruised feelings, after Carvalho intervened in the conflict in Charleston

Leeser, Isaac and Carvalho, Solomon Nunes. Charleston, SC, Letter from Solomon Nunes Carvalho (1815-1897) in Charleston, South Carolina to Rev. Isaac Lesser (1806-1868) in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. In this lengthy three page letter Carvalho details the very public arguments at the Shearit Israel concerning the role of Rev. Ellis Lyons vs. the Reader Dr. E. The Rev. Ellis Lyons wrote a letter excommunicating Dr. E and denounced the Congregation for acting out of order and forfeiting all claims to orthodoxy. Carvalho comments on Lyons' impertinence at excommunicating Dr. E

Leeser, Isaac and Carvalho, Solomon Nunes. Charleston, SC, Letter from Solomon Nunes Carvalho (1815-1897) in Charleston, South Carolina to Rev. Isaac Lesser (1806-1868) in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. In this letter Carvalho suggests and offers various points that Leeser can use to refute his accusers, after his break with Isaac Mayer Wise
Leeser, Isaac and Carvalho, Solomon Nunes. Charleston, SC, Signed letter from David Carvalho to Isaac Leeser, ordering books

Leeser, Isaac and Carvalho, Solomon Nunes. Charleston, SC, Three page letter from Solomon Nunes Carvalho to Isaac Leeser, in which Carvalho gives Leeser advice on how to treat people who attack him in the "Asmoneon," the first successful Jewish periodical in the United States

Leeser, Isaac and Cohen, Abraham Meyers. Philadelphia, PA, Letter from Abraham Meyers Cohen, Secretary of Mikveh Israel, to Isaac Leeser, in which Cohen records the election of Isaac Leeser as the new Hazan at the important Mikveh Israel Synagogue in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania

Leeser, Isaac and Cohen, I. I. Rome, NY, Letter from I . I. Cohen in Rome, NY to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia, PA, in which Cohen asks whether he owes money for his recent gift of a copy of the Occident to Mrs. Cohen

Leeser, Isaac and Cohen, J. I. Baltimore, MD, Business letter from J. I. Cohen to Isaac Leeser, in which Cohen promises to secure an additional twnety five subscribers for Leeser's soon to be published books
Leeser, Isaac and Cohen, Jacob M. Baltimore, MD, Letter from Jacob M. Cohen to Isaac Leeser regarding a subscription
Leeser, Isaac and Cohen, Joshua I. Baltimore, MD, Letter from Joshua I. Cohen regarding his library and criticism of Miss Aquilar's work

Leeser, Isaac and Cohen, Joshua I. Philadelphia, PA, Two page letter from Joshua I. Cohen (1801-1870) in Baltimore with his full signature to Isaac LeeserThe letter discusses Hebrew subjects about which he and Leeser are mutually interested and evidently writing about for articles for the Occident

Leeser, Isaac and Cohen, Mendes I. Baltimore, MD, Letter from Mendes I. Cohen (1796-1879) in Baltimore to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia. Writing on behalf of the Rev. S. M. Isaacs of New York City, Cohen asks Leeser to let it be known that the brother of Rev. S. M. Isaacs, Rev. Professor David M. Isaacs, of Liverpool was in the United States in search of a position

Leeser, Isaac and Cohen, Miriam Gratz Moses. Savannah, GA, Letter from Mariam Gratz Moses Cohen to Isaac Leeser. The letter includes a friendly note and mentions giving a check to Rebecca to give to him for books
Leeser, Isaac and Cohen, S. Philadelphia, PA, Signed letter in German from S. Cohen of New York City to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia

Leeser, Isaac and Cohen, Solomon. Savannah, GA, Letter from Solomon Cohen in Savannah, Georgia to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, in which he tells Leeser that his decline in readership is part of the decay of Judaism in America, and includes a strongly stated argument for "American" Reform

Leeser, Isaac and Cohen, Sophie Waldon. San Francisco, CA, Letter from Sophie Waldon Cohen in San Francisco, sending an article she wrote to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia, asking him to print it in the Occident
Leeser, Isaac and Cohn, J. New York, NY, Letter from J. Cohn in New York City to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia, ordering a book and asking that it be sent to Mr. Seixas

Leeser, Isaac and Cordova, Raphael de. Philadelphia, PA, A letter from Jacob Mordecai of Richmond, Virginia, responding to a request by Raphael De Cordova, a trustee and benefactor of Mikveh Israel in Philadelphia. De Cordova is inquiring into the suitability of Isaac Leeser, who is being considered for the position as Hazan. It is a glowing letter of recommendation that helps Leeser obtain his first important pulpit
Leeser, Isaac and Crawcour, I. L. New Orleans, LA, Two page letter from I.L Crawcour requesting prayer books for his wife
Leeser, Isaac and Daurt, M. N. Curacao, Letter from S. M. Duart in Curacao to Rev. Isaac Leeser, in regards to his selling prayer books and Occidents
Leeser, Isaac and Daurt, M. N. Curacao, Letter from S. M. Duart in Curacao to Rev. Isaac Leeser, in which Duart complains that his books are too large, and outlines numerous suggestions for size
Leeser, Isaac and Daurt. Curacao, Letter from Daurt to Isaac Leeser, mentioning the personal attacks being made against Leeser
Leeser, Isaac and David, O. W. Curacao, Letter from O. W. David in Curacao, Dutch West Indies to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia. The letter is replete with news about various Jews in Curacao

Leeser, Isaac and Davis, M. M. New York, NY, Letter from M.M. Davis of New York City to Isaac Leeser in Phialdelphia. Davis asks for his help in finding, in the Philadelphia area, a Catholic orphan to train a young girl for domestic chores. He further inquires about Leeser's ill health
Leeser, Isaac and Davis, Solomon. Richmond, VA, Letter from Solomon Davis in Richmond, Virginia to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia, requesting books for his wife, Anna Davis
Leeser, Isaac and Davis, Z. A. Philadelphia, PA, Letter from Z.A. Davis, informing Isaac Leeser that he has been elected as an honorary member of the Hebrew Beneficient Society
Leeser, Isaac and De Horta, Israel. Mobile, AL, Letter from Israel De Horta in Mobile, Alabama to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia. The letter includes relevant pages from De Horta's copy book

Leeser, Isaac and De la Motta Jr., Jacob. Savannah, GA, Letter from Jacob De la Motta Jr. in Savannah, Georgia to Isaac Leeser, in which De la Motta praises Leeser for his efforts on behalf of Judaism and also notes the receipt of books

Leeser, Isaac and De la Motta, Jacob. Charleston, SC, Inclomplete letter from Dr. Jacob De la Motta to Isaac Leeser. The letter gives a firsthand account of the dispute at Beth Elohim that caused him to lead a group of congregants from Beth Elohim to form a new Orthodox congregation, Shearith Israel
Leeser, Isaac and De la Motta, Jacob. Charleston, SC, Letter from Jacob De la Motta to Isaac Leeser regarding the Occident

Leeser, Isaac and De la Motta, Jacob. Charleston, SC, Letter from the physician Jacob De la Motta in Charleston, South Carolina to rev. Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, in which De la Motta cholera and his inability to visit Leeser due to the outbreak in Charleston

Leeser, Isaac and De Young, Abraham. Lafayette, LA, Letter from Abraham De Young, president of the newly formed congregation in Lafayette, Louisiana, to Isaac Leeser, announcing a newly rented temple for his congregation
Leeser, Isaac and Demery, Leo L. New Orleans, LA, Letter from Leo L. Demery to Isaac Leeser, in which Demery mentions not having received his Occident

Leeser, Isaac and Demery, Leo L. New Orleans, LA, Two short letters from Leo L. Demery in New Orleans, in which he complains of having not received his subscription of the Occident and of Leeser's irregularity
Leeser, Isaac and Dessau, A. Macon, GA, Letter from A. Dessau in Macon, Georgia to Isaac Leeser, in which Dessau discusses progress in this small Jewish community
Leeser, Isaac and Ducachet, Henry W. Philadelphia, PA, Letter from Henry W. Ducachet, the rector of St. Stephen's Episcopal Church of Philadelphia to Isaac Leeser

Leeser, Isaac and Dyer, Hannah. Galveston, TX, Personal letter from Hannah Dyer in Galveston, Texas to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia. In the letter she thanks Leeser for placing memorials in the Occident

Leeser, Isaac and Dyer, Leon. Baltimore, MD, Personal letter from Colonel Leon Dyer in Baltimore, Maryland to Isaac Leeser. The letter contains information on Dyer's sister, and asks Leeser to provide the five dollars due to Mikveh Israel from his brother Abraham
Leeser, Isaac and E. H. Lindo. Curacao, Letter from E. H. Lindo in Curacao, Dutch West Indies to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania regarding his selling prayer books and Occidents for Leeser

Leeser, Isaac and Eckard, Susan B. Philadelphia, PA, Letter from Susan B. Eckard in Philadelphia to Isaac Leeser, in which Eckard (a Christian) asks to attend the dedication of a new synagogue building in Philadelphia

Leeser, Isaac and Eckman, Julius. Charleston, SC, Letter from Rabbi Julius Eckman, the Rabbi of Beth Elohim in Charleston, South Carolina to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia. Eckman is responding to an article accusing him of inconsistency, and it continues at length regarding his faith and principles. The letter includes a lengthy response in Isaac Leeser's hand

Leeser, Isaac and Ederheimer, Isiah. New York, NY, Signed letter from Isiah Ederheimer in New York to Isaac Leeser, asking him for a duplicate of his marriage certificate, and also that the certificate be written in German
Leeser, Isaac and Edinger, S. New Orleans, LA, Short note from S. Edinger to Isaac Leeser, ordering three dozen Hebrew Primers to be sent by Adams Express

Leeser, Isaac and Ehrlich, Moses. Boston, MA, Letter from Moses Ehrlich in Boston, Massachusetts to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia, in which Ehrlich asks Leeser to print recent resolutions of the congregation, which are the product of an argument between the recent Polander members and the long standing German members, over the administration of the legacy of Judah Touro

Leeser, Isaac and Einstein, Joseph. Philadelphia, PA, Letter from Joseph Einstein of Philadelphia to Isaac Leeser informing him that he has secured Leeser a new weekly subscriber, a Mr. P. Morris of Crawfordsville, Georgia

Leeser, Isaac and Eisner, C. I. St. Louis, MO, Letter from C.I. Eisner, Secretary of the Finance Committee of the United Hebrew Congregation in St. Louis, to Isaac Leeser, requesting his help through an article in the newspaper to raise funds for the new school they are building

Leeser, Isaac and Elkus, Jeanette. Denekamp, Netherlands, Four page letter written by Jeanette Elkus, the daughter of Isaac Leeser's elder sister Leah, to Isaac Leeser. The first two pages of the letter are in English and pages 3 and 4 are in Judeo-German in cursive Aschkenazic script

Leeser, Isaac and Emanuel, B. M. Claiborne, AL, Letter from B.M. Emanuel in Claiborne to Isaac Leeser, profusely apologizing for not keeping a promise to pay for a subscription and a book he purchased
Leeser, Isaac and Emanuel, B. M. Mobile, AL, Letter from Baruch M. Emanuel, Hazan and Schochet of Shaatai Shomayim in Mobile, Alabama, to Isaac Leeser, informing him of the death of Rev. A. Ansel

Leeser, Isaac and Englander, A. N. San Francisco, CA, Letter from A. N. Englander to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia. Englander, a congregant of Temple Emanu-El in San Francisco, California, writes in detail on Dr. Elkan Cohn's maiden sermons. The letter also discusses the debates going in in the congregation
Leeser, Isaac and Eppstein, M. Fort Wayne, IN, Letter from M. Eppstein in Fort Wayne, Indiana to Isaac Leeser, with an ad to be placed in the Occident
Leeser, Isaac and Epstein, A. Savannah, GA, Letter from A. Epstein in Savannah, Georgia to Isaac Leeser. It deals with the sales of unleavened bread in Georgia

Leeser, Isaac and Ezekiel, H. C. Cincinnati, OH, Signed letter from H. C. Ezekiel in Cincinnati on the printed letterhead of the office of Gottlieb and Ezekiel, dealers in government groups, clothing, and dry goods to Isaac Leeser asking if he publishes the book "Daily prayers according to the Reform Minhag America."

Leeser, Isaac and Ezekiel, J. New Orleans, LA, A hand written notice from J. Ezekiel in New Orleans to Isaac for insertion in the Occident, upon the formation of the Hebrew Benevolent Association, the adoption of its constitution and the election of its officers

Leeser, Isaac and Ezelkiel, Jacob. Richmond, VA, Letter from Jacob Ezekiel of Richmond, Virginia to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, in which Ezekiel asks for Leeser's assistance in amending or abrogating older laws in Vriginia that impinge upon Jewish rights

Leeser, Isaac and Ezelkiel, Jacob. Richmond, VA, Seven page letter from Jacob Ezekiel of Richmond, Virginia to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. In the first part of the letter, Ezekiel suggests that Leeser publish 1000 four-volume sets of Leeser's life time works. The letter also deals with the politics and planning in the break up of the Richmond community into two or more congregations

scopecontent.p: LSKAP0217_1r.tif; LSKAP0217_1v.tif; LSKAP0217_2r.tif; LSKAP0217_2v.tif; LSKAP0217_3r.tif; LSKAP0217_3v.tif; LSKAP0217_4r.tif

did.unittitle: Leeser, Isaac and Feldenheimer, D. Petersburg, VA, Short note from D. Feldenheimer in Petersburg, Virginia to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia, asking that he include his marriage notice in the next issue of the Occident
Leeser, Isaac and Freedman, Joseph. Detroit, MI, Letter from Joseph Feedman in Detroit, Michigan to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia, asking Leeser to be a match maker

Leeser, Isaac and Freudenthal, Rabbi. Williamsport, PA, Letter in English and German from Rabbi Freudenthal in Williamsport, Pennsylvania to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia, asking him to forward a brief curriculum in religion to prepare students for the confirmation
Leeser, Isaac and Fromenfeld, A. Pittsburgh, PA, Letter from A. Fromenfeld in Pittsburgh, PA to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia, PA, in which Fromenfeld inserts an ad and a note in Yiddish

Leeser, Isaac and Gallinger, N. Pittsburgh, PA, Early letter from N. Gallinger in Pittsburgh, PA to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia, PA noting that twenty five poor families cannot feed their family for seven days working only five
Leeser, Isaac and Gallinger, N. Pittsburgh, PA, Letter from N. Gallinger, Leeser's agent in Pittsburgh, PA to Isaac Leeser regarding sales to Rodeph Shalom

Leeser, Isaac and Goldschmidt, Abraham. St. Louis, MO, Single page letter written and signed by Abraham Goldschmidt of St. Louis to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia, thanking Leeser for his kindness during his last visit. The letter is written in very stilted English

Leeser, Isaac and Goldsmith, Henry. New York, NY, Letter from H. Goldsmith, a Hebrew school teacher in New York City, to Isaac Leeser, in which Goldsmith expounds his views on the English translation from the Hebrew of Gen. III.22. This letter was published in the Occident
Leeser, Isaac and Goldsmith, Henry. New York, NY, Printed invitation to Rev. Isaac Leeser from Henry Goldsmith to attend the laying of the foundation of the Congregation B'ne Jeshurun

Leeser, Isaac and Goldsmith, Jonas. Baltimore, MD, Letter from J. Goldsmith in Baltimore to Isaac Leeser, asking for a subscription at half price since he is an educator. The letter is in German with a translation

Leeser, Isaac and Gottheld, B. H. Louisville, KY, Letter from B.H. Gottheld in Louisville, Kentucky, the Rabbi of K.K. Adas Israel, to Isaac Leeser, ordering an Occident for Marcus Straus and discussing his search for an English scholar capable of imparting instruction in Hebrew langauge and religion

Leeser, Isaac and Gotthelf, Bernard. Louisville, KY, Letter from Rabbi Bernard Henry Gotthelf in Louisville, Kentucky to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia. It includes a rare detailed description of his duties and the workings of the congregation. Written in German with translation

scopecontent.p: LSKAP0048_1R.tif; LSKAP0048_1V.tif; LSKAP0048_2R.tif; LSKAP0048_2V.tif; LSKAP0048_3R.tif; LSKAP0048_3V.tif; LSKAP0048_4R.tif; LSKAP0048_5R.tif; LSKAP0048_6R.tif; LSKAP0048_7R.tif; LSKAP0048_8R.tif

did.unittitle: Leeser, Isaac and Greenbaum, Jacob. San Francisco, CA, Letter from Jacob Greenbaum to Rabbi Isaac Leeser, written on stationary from H. Cohen, importer of clothing. He discusses an article in the Gleaner and also references I.O.B.B
Leeser, Isaac and Greenewald. Philadelphia, PA, Letter from Greenewald and Kohlberg to Isaac Leeser regarding his subscription

Leeser, Isaac and Gunzburg, Aaron. Baltimore, MD, Letter from Dr. Aaron Gunzburg in Baltimore to Isaac Leeser, offering to supply an article for Leeser and to consider selling books at his Hebrew school. Written in German with translation

Leeser, Isaac and Haart. Trenton, NJ, Personal letter from Mr. Haart of Trenton, NJ to Rev, Isaac Leeser, apologizing for the fact that Isaac Leeser gave his mentally unbalanced son $5.00. Mr. Haart asks Isaac Leeser to lecture the boy and send him home if he shows up again
Leeser, Isaac and Hackenberg, William. Philadelphia, PA, Printed and partially filled out dunning letter for the Isaac Leeser estate in Philadelphia, from William Hackenberg

Leeser, Isaac and Hackenburg, Isaac. Cincinnati, OH, Letter from Isaac Hackenburg in Cincinnati, Ohio to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania with news from Cincinnati. He gives his informed view of the election of Isaac Mayer Wise as the new Minister and his assessment of the Congregation. He also inquires as to the public nature of the discussion between Poznanski and Wise on one side and Raphael and Rosenfeld on the other. He also asks for some details on the Minor Shohet scandal in Savannah
Leeser, Isaac and Hall, John. Newton, MA, Letter from John Hall of Newton, Massachusetts to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia. He thanks Leeser for the loan of a copy of Mendelssohn's treatise

Leeser, Isaac and Hart, A. H. Philadelphia, PA, Signed letter from both A.H. Hart and I. Binswanger to Rev. Isaac Leeser, thanking Leeser and M. A. Dropsie for their speaking at the first annual charity dinner. The letter includes a copt of the resolution

Leeser, Isaac and Hart, A. Philadelphia, PA, Historically important letter written and signed by the Board of Mikveh Israel to the parnas, A. Hart, instructing him to call a special meeting of Mikveh Israel members to repel the vote of censure of Isaac Leeser. Additionally, the letter requests the preparation of an appropriate resolution for Leeser
Leeser, Isaac and Hart, A. Philadelphia, PA, Signed letter from A. Hart to Isaac Leeser, giving him the authority to conduct a wedding for Reuben Hyman and Heanettie Heyneberg

Leeser, Isaac and Hart, Isaac. Detroit, MI, Letter written by Isaac Hart from Detroit to Isaac Leeser, in which he explains that while he has been in Detroit for two years he has not joined a Congregation as they are not to his liking. The letter is written on the letterhead of D.J. Workum, hats, caps, and gents' furnishing goods

Leeser, Isaac and Hart, Isaac. New Orleans, LA, Highly personal letter from Isaac Hart in New Orleans, Louisiana to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, in which Hart responds to a long letter from Leeser, in which Leeser complains of Isaac Wise's Reform activity and competition from other Jewish publications. Hart expresses sympathy that Leeser is not appreciated for all he has done for America's Jews and he suggests changes to Leeser's publication

Leeser, Isaac and Hart, Isaac. New Orleans, LA, Letter from Isaac Hart in New Orleans, Louisiana to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, in which Hart describes the success of the Jewish Benevolent Society's ball, and discusses business about books

Leeser, Isaac and Hart, Isaac. New Orleans, LA, Letter from Isaac Hart in New Orleans, Louisiana to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, in which he outlines the election of new trustees for Shanarai-Chasset. He also references the first jew in Arkansas, Mr. Block

Leeser, Isaac and Hart, Isaac. New Orleans, LA, Letter from Isaac Hart in New Orleans, Louisiana to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. In the letter, Hart describes being compelled to be president of Shanarai-Chasset for another year, and notes the lack of secrecy in the movement of Touro's body. It also lists accounts for the Occident

Leeser, Isaac and Hart, Isaac. New Orleans, LA, Letter from Isaac Hart in New Orleans, Louisiana to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. The letter deals with Shanarai-Chasset's seach for a new Rabbi. It ends with negative comments on the portuguese Congregation and their criticisms of Leeser's new Bible

Leeser, Isaac and Hart, Isaac. New Orleans, LA, Letter from Isaac Hart in New Orleans, Louisiana to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. The letter is a first hand observation of High Holiday services at both the Portuguese and Polish synagogues, and includes a description of the new burial ground

Leeser, Isaac and Hart, Isaac. New Orleans, LA, Printed letter from the Hewbrew Congregation of "The Dispersed of Judah" written by Alexander Abrams, giving notice that seats for the year are now on sale with prices. Inside is a hand written note from Isaac Hart to Isaac Leeser

Leeser, Isaac and Hart, Louise B. Philadelphia, PA, Letter written by Louise B. Hart, an influential Philadelphian Jewish womand and an associate of Rebecca Gratz, inviting Isaac Leeser to attend the Annual Meeting of the Ladies' Hebrew Sewing Society at the Portuguese Synagogue

Leeser, Isaac and Hart, Samuel, Sr. Charleston, SC, Samuel Hart Senior, the agent for Isaac Leeser's Occident, writes this three page letter from Charleston to Isaac Leeser, sending a check on a New York bank for the Occident and Jewish Publication Society. He also requests that a receipt be sent to David Lopez who had sent payment for Occident

Leeser, Isaac and Hart, Samuel. Charleston, SC, Letter from Samuel Hart in Charleston to Isaac Leeser. The letter opens with a discussion of books and Occident subscriptions. The body of the letter deals with observations on Dr. Isaac Wise and his new appointment

Leeser, Isaac and Hart, Samuel. Charleston, SC, Letter from Samuel Hart in Charleston, South Carolina to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia, PA. Part of the letter deals with the upcoming marriage of Miss Tobias and Mr. Minnis of Savannah, Georgia

Leeser, Isaac and Hart, W. New York, NY, Detailed business letter from W. Hart in New York to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia, asking that Leeser forward two hundred and fifty copies of the Report of the Special Committee of the Congregation B'nai Jershun to James M. Ruphah, Secretary of the congregation

Leeser, Isaac and Harvey, J. Charleston, SC, Letter from J. Harvey to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia. He requests that Leeser publish his editorial which is in the body of the letter. In his proposed editorial, while opposed to the general Reform Movement, he speaks well of certain aspects at Kal Kadosh Beth Elohim, while criticizing others with a particular view on the role of women in a Sunday school

Leeser, Isaac and Henry, Henry A. New York, NY, Seven page letter from Rabbi Henry A. Henry to Isaac Leeser, in which Henry accuses Leeser of a series of unfounded personal attacks. It also accuses Leeser of withholding from print valid rebuttals to his accusations

scopecontent.p: LSKAP0121_1_1r.tif; LSKAP0121_1_1v.tif; LSKAP0121_1_2r.tif; LSKAP0121_1_2v.tif; LSKAP0121_1_3r.tif; LSKAP0121_1_3v.tif; LSKAP0121_1_4r.tif

did.unittitle: Leeser, Isaac and Henry, Henry A. Syracuse, NY, Letter from the Rev. H.A. Henry in Syracuse, NY to S. Valentine in Charleston, SC., in which Henry demands justice for the personal slander by Isaac Leeser

Leeser, Isaac and Hershorn, J. R. Providence, RI, Letter from J.R. Hershorn in Providence, Rhode Island to Isaac Leeser, detailing the surprise celebration for the retirement of the president and founder of the "Sons of Israel and David", Solomon Pareira. Hershorn, the son-in-law of Solomon Pareira, includes a detailed description of the goblet given to Pareira and the text of Pareira's address

Leeser, Isaac and Herzog, Jacob. Lancaster, PA, Letter from Jacob Herzog in Lancaster, PA to Isaac Leeser, announcing the chartering of the Lancaster Congregation. Written in German, it lists all the officers

Leeser, Isaac and Hillman, L. Nashville, TN, Letter from L. Hillman in Nashville, Tennessee to Isaac Leeser, reporting on the activities of their small congregation, and their plans to ask the legislature to incorporate the congregation next month

Leeser, Isaac and Hirsch, Simha. Philadelphia, PA, Letter from Simha Hirsch of Philadelphia to Isaac Leeser, regarding the controversy Leeser is having with the Rabbi in Charleston over the interpretation of "I will be what I will be" in Exodus 3:14

Leeser, Isaac and Hobman, S. Cincinnati, OH, Letter from S. Hobman in Cincinnati, Ohio to Rev. Isaac Leeser, asking for help in placing a poor 55 year old woman in a foster home where she can work for her keep

Leeser, Isaac and Hochstavber, Isidor. Santa Fe, NM, Letter from Isidor Hochstavber to Isaac Leeser, telling of how he received a copy of the Occident from Solomon Jacob Spiegelberg and was so impressed that he would like to become a subscriber
Leeser, Isaac and Hockstaeder, J. H. Milwaukee, WI, Letter from J.H. Hockstaeder in Milwaukee, Wisconsin to Isaac Leeser, asking him to send the Occident to Milwaulkee

Leeser, Isaac and Illoway, Henry. New Orleans, LA, Letter from Henry Illoway in New Orleans, Louisiana to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, informing him that his father has stepped down as the Rabbi in New Orleans, and asking that a glowing commentary on his father's success in New Orleans be published. He attaches one that was prepared by a young friend

Leeser, Isaac and Illowy, Bernard. New Orleans, LA, Five page letter from Joseph Jacobsohn in New Orleans, Louisiana to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. The letter contains a detailed account as to how the German young men from the North took over his Orthodox synagogue and turned it into a Reform synagogue. The letter also relates the general decline of Judaism in New Orleans before Rabbi Bernard Illowy and how in his four year tenure, turned it around

Leeser, Isaac and Illowy, Bernard. New Orleans, LA, Letter from Joseph Jacobsohn, written on the embossed stationary of Shaarai-Chasset to Isaac Leeser, regarding questions on Rabbi Illowy's edict that children of a Christian mother can not be circumcised

Leeser, Isaac and Illowy, Bernard. Philadelphia, PA, Letter from Rabbi Bernard Illowy to Isaac Leeser, asking that Leeser send copies of past Occidents that he requested. He also mentions a Mr. B. Abeles and a Mr. Grunsfelder as persons to see for funds that are owed. Written in German with a translation

Leeser, Isaac and Illowy, Henry. New Orleans, LA, Five page letter from Henry Illowy, the son of Rabbi Henry Illowy, in New Orleans, Louisiana to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia. The letter strongly rebukes Leeser for his attacks on his father, and criticizes Leeser for playing the middleground between the Reformers and supporting Rabbis who move toward the Reform
Leeser, Isaac and Isaacs, I. I. New York, NY, Letter from I.I. Isaacs to Isaac Leeser regarding a subscription

Leeser, Isaac and Isaacs, J. S. Philadelphia, PA, Note from J.S. Isaacs on the letterhead of "L.J. and I. Phillips and Co., fur and cap manufacturers" in Philadelphia to Isaac Leeser, requesting a bible for his brother

Leeser, Isaac and Isaacs, Myer Samuel. New York, NY, Letter from Myer S. Isaacs of New York City on the letterhead of "The Jewish Messenger" to Isaac Leeser. The letter acknowledges Leeser's request to call a meeting of the "Board of Delegates."
Leeser, Isaac and Jackson, William. Philadelphia, PA, Letter from William Jackson, an inmate in the Philadelphia Country Prison to Isaac Leeser, pleading with Leeser to come and visit him in prison

Leeser, Isaac and Jacobowsky, J. D. Holmesville, OH, Letter from J.D. Jacobowsky in Holmesville, Ohio to Isaac Leeser in which he sends $6.00 for the Occident and $3.00 for one of Leeser's bibles in Hebrew for his friend H. Eichenstine
Leeser, Isaac and Jacobs, L. Charleston, SC, Signed letter fragment from L. Jacobs in Charleston, SC to Isaac Leeser, containing a diatribe against Jacobs's antagonist

Leeser, Isaac and Jarodawski, L. Pittsburgh, PA, Letter from Mr. L. Jarodawski in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania to Issac Leeser in Philadelphia, relating that Mr. Lecy of Philadelphia is dying. Jarodawski, on behalf of his community, asks Leeser to mediate with his brother, Mr. Tobias, as the cost has put a burden on the small community

Leeser, Isaac and John S. Meehan. Washington, DC, A printed form with the autograph of John S. Meehan, the librarian of the Library of Congress, acknowledging the receipt of "The book of daily prayers for every day in the year according to the custom of the German and Polish Jews." Edited by Isaac Leeser and printed by Sherman, 1848

Leeser, Isaac and Jonas, Joseph. Cinncinati, OH, Two letters written to Isaac Leeser on one sheet. The first page is written by Lewis Abraham, from Cincinnati, Ohio. The last two pages are from Joseph Jonas, a watchmaker and silversmith by trade, who was one of the first Jews to settle in the area west of the Allegheny Mountains

Leeser, Isaac and Jones, Alfred T. Philadelphia, PA, A letter from Alfred T. Jones, Secretary of the Hebrew Education Society of Philadelphia. The letter contains the annual report of the society, listing the officers and Board of Directors, and the treasurer's report. This document was sent to Isaac leeser for publication in The Occident

Leeser, Isaac and Jones, Israel J. Mobile, AL, A letter from Israel Jones in Mobile, Alabama to Isaac Leeser, informing him of a fire that destroyed the Sha'arai Shomayim Synagogue in Mobile, Alabama, of which Jones is the president, and asking that a plea for donations be placed in the Occident

Leeser, Isaac and Joseph, Jacob Henry. Montreal, Canada, A letter written by Jacob Henry Joseph from Montreal, Canada to Rev. Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. Joseph is a successful Canadian financier, active in the Jewish Community and an associate of Leeser’s. In this letter, Mr. Joseph takes Leeser to task for his difficult personality and unwillingness to satisfy anyone

Leeser, Isaac and Joseph, Jesse. Montreal, Canada, A three page letter from a Canadian communal leader, Jesse Joseph of Montreal, to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. The first part of the letter contains detailed suggestions as to how he might help Leeser sell books and his newspaper in Canada. He then talks about the state of the Canadian economy. Lastly he deals with his review of the Jewish institutions

Leeser, Isaac and Joseph, Jesse. Montreal, Canada, A two page letter from a Canadian communal leader, Jesse Joseph of Montreal, to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. The letter deals with financial matters but importantly takes Leeser to task for ignoring Jewish happenings in Canada, particularly the work that was submitted to him by Dr. David

Leeser, Isaac and Joseph, Jesse. Montreal, Canada, A two page letter from a Canadian communal leader, Jesse Joseph of Montreal, to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. This is a chatty letter full of personal detail and insights into unrecorded family history
Leeser, Isaac and Judah, David. Baltimore, MD, A letter from David Judah in Richmond, Virginia to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania regarding travel arrangements and family matters

Leeser, Isaac and Judah, David. Baltimore, MD, A letter from David Judah in Richmond, Virginia to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. In this letter, Judah cautions Leeser to be more tolerant in his criticism of others. He also includes some local news

Leeser, Isaac and Judah, David. Baltimore, MD, A letter from David Judah in Baltimore, Maryland to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, in which Judah writes urgently about Zalma Rehine's poor health and suggests Isaac comes to visit his Uncle
Leeser, Isaac and Judah, David. Baltimore, MD, A letter from David Judah in Richmond, Virginia to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania regarding family matters
Leeser, Isaac and Judah, David. Baltimore, MD, A letter from David Judah to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania regarding the death of Ms. Aguilar, a noted Jewish authoress
Leeser, Isaac and Judah, David. Baltimore, MD, A letter from David Judah to Isaac Leeser regarding book business

Leeser, Isaac and Judah, David. Baltimore, MD, A letter written by David Judah from Richmond, Virginia to a young Isaac Leeser in Baltimore, Maryland. In this letter, Judah expresses his reservations and gives suggestions on the draft of Leeser's first book "Instructions in the Mosaic Religion"

Leeser, Isaac and Judah, David. Baltimore, MD, A one page letter from David Judah in Richmond, Virginia to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. In this letter, Judah suggests that Leeser, who had just taken his position at Mikveh Israel, stop publishing in what Judah calls the "Christian form."

Leeser, Isaac and Judah, David. Philadelphia, PA, A two page letter from Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia to David Judah of Baltimore, Maryland, in which he expresses his unhappiness with his Philadelphian congregants. The letter also speeks to Leeser's banking and financial issues

Leeser, Isaac and Judah, David. Richmond, VA, A two page letter from David Judah in Richmond, Virginia to a young Isaac Leeser in Baltimore, Maryland. In this chatty letter, Judah discusses commission activity for Mrs. Jacobs, a Sunday trip on the James River, his trip to Norfolk where he had breakfast with Solomon Marks, and his stage coach ride to Philadelphia
Leeser, Isaac and Judah, Reinah. Baltimore, MD, Letter requesting assistance with rent

Leeser, Isaac and Judah, Rumah. Charleston, SC, A letter from Rumah Judah, Isaac Leeser's aunt and wife of Zalma Rehine, to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia. Writing during her trip to see relatives in Charleston, South Carolina, Rumah relates her family observations

Leeser, Isaac and Judah, Samuel. Vincennes, IL, A letter from Samuel Judah in Vincennes, Indiana to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia. In this letter, he discusses reading a book from London on the Karaites and is anxious to know if Leeser has any publications on the subject in Philadelphia. He also orders a book and discusses its binding

Leeser, Isaac and Katz, Benjamin. Dulman, Germany, A one page letter from Rabbi Benjamin Jacob Katz, a former teacher of Leeser's, from Dulman, Germany to Isaac Leeser in Muster, Germany. The letter is written almost entirely in Yiddish, and is the only known document that survives from Leeser's formative period in Europe

Leeser, Isaac and Kohn, A. Chicago, IL, A three page letter written by A. Kohn of Chicago, Illinois to Isaac Leeserin New York City. In this letter, Kohn expresses his concern for Judaism in America and the need for Jewish institutions such as hospitals, colleges and sabbath schools. A. Kohn will go on to found the first synagogue in Chicago, "Kehilath Anshe Ma'ativ " in 1851

Leeser, Isaac and Kursheedt, Gershom. New Orleans, LA, A four page letter written by Gershom Kursheedt in New Orleans to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia. In the letter, Kursheedt outlines his secretive plans to have Judah Touro's remains brought back to Newport, Rhode Island for burial. This letter goes into great detail regarding the funeral, including the required length and style of the speakers as well as the prohibition of a public procession in New York City. It also speaks to funds that should go to Leeser's proposed Educational Society ($20,000) but will not be forth coming unless Leeser takes legal action

Leeser, Isaac and Kursheedt, Gershom. New Orleans, LA, A four page letter written by Gershom Kursheedt in New Orleans to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia. The first part of the letter is a unique insight as to how Kursheedt "handles" Judah Touro when asking for funds and Touro's expected reaction. The second is a surprising discussion on the Jews in China. The remainder is Kursheedt's concern as to his personal lack of funds to further help Jews and then his observations on the local scene with the Reform

Leeser, Isaac and Kursheedt, Gershom. New Orleans, LA, A three page letter written by Gershom Kursheedt in New Orleans to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia. In this letter, Kursheedt chides Leeser for attacking his friends, and writes his point by point objections to Dr. Wise's Reform elements

Leeser, Isaac and Kursheedt, M. New Orleans, LA, A one page letter from Rabbi M. Kursheedt in New Orleans to Isaac Leeser, submitting the list of newly elected officers and trustees of Sharmari Hafsed. In a separate letter on the same page he notes that Leeser had recommend Rev. H. A. Henry, but they have recently learned that he had taken a position in Cincinnati

Leeser, Isaac and Kuttnauer, S. Baltimore, MD, A letter from S. Kuttnauer of Baltimore, Maryland to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia.The letter is written entirely in German with few Hebrew words interspersed. Kuttnauer writes that a friend in Washington D.C. suggested that he write and that he just came from Frankfurt, Germany. He asks Leeser to help him find a suitable job

Leeser, Isaac and Labatt, Abraham Cohen. San Francisco, CA, A letter from Abraham Cohen Labatt, a prominent pioneer of Reform Judaism, in San Francisco to Isaac Leeser. Labatt writes about how well his congregation is doing and asks Leeser to him him find a suitable Rabbi

Leeser, Isaac and Labatt, D. C. New Orleans, LA, A letter from David Cohen Labatt in New orleans, Louisiana to Isaac Leeser, in which Labatt notes that he cannot find a representative to sell Occidents in New Orleans

Leeser, Isaac and Labatt, H. New Orleans, LA, A letter from H. Labatt of New Orleans, Louisiana to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia. Labatt writes of his concerns of anti-Semitic slurs against two Louisiana elected officials, J.P. Benjamin, a Whig senator elect, and E.W. Moise, a Democrat ex-speaker of the house

Leeser, Isaac and Labatt, Henry Jacob. New Orleans, LA, A letter from Henry Jacob Labatt (1832-1900) of New Orleans, Louisiana to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia regarding book business. It includes a book rquest from Judah Touro

Leeser, Isaac and Labatt, Henry Jacob. New Orleans, LA, A letter from Henry Jacob Labatt (1832-1900) of New Orleans, Louisiana to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia. Labatt writes of his concerns of anti-Semitic slurs against two Louisiana elected officials, J.P. Benjamin, a Whig senator elect, and E.W. Moise, a Democrat ex-speaker of the house
Leeser, Isaac and Lanfirtz, J. Fort Wayne, IN, A letter from J. Lanfirtz in Fort Wayne, Indiana to Isaac Leeser. His letter is solely about the Reform Movement

Leeser, Isaac and Lavsano, Joshua. Charleston, SC, A letter from Joshua Lavsano in Charleston, South Carolina to Isaac Leeser. He writes of the major problems the Jewish Community is having regarding the battle over the form of services in the synagogue Beth Elohim. He relates that as a member, he can see no possibility of cooperation. He thanks Reverend Leeser for his intervention but things have gone down divergant paths. He notes that a meeting was held to consider the Philadelphia recommendation of one joint synagogue, but it was soundly rebuffed

Leeser, Isaac and Lazarus, Joshua. Charleston, SC, A letter from Joshua Lazarus of Charleston, South Carolina, president and founder of the Charleston Gas Light Co. and president of the Kahal Kadosh Beth Elohim Synagogue, to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia. He describes in detail how he wants his bible bound

Leeser, Isaac and Leeser, Abraham. Muenster, Germany, This single sheet letter is from Isaac Leeser's uncle, Abraham Leeser on one side and Isaac Leeser's sister, Leah Lippmann on the other. The two are writing to Isaac Leeser to request that he allow them to accompy him on his trip to America (though neither of them actually did in the end). It is from Sternberg, Germany, 1823 and is addressed to Isaac Leeser, who was then in Munster Germany where he had just received his final formal education. The letter is entirely penned in Yiddish, and accompanied with a reliable translation to English accomplished circa 1950

Leeser, Isaac and Leeser, Jacob Lippman. Baltimore, MD, A letter from jacob Lippman Leeser in Baltimore, Maryland to his older brother Isaac Leeser. Jacob writes of family and friends and sends his regards to Miss Cozen, Isaac's gentile house keeper. Letters from Jacob Leeser are rare, as much of Leeser's personal family correspondence was destroyed at his death

Leeser, Isaac and Leevier, R. D. New York, NY, A three page letter from R.D. Leevier in New York City to isaac Leeser. He had been referred by a Mr. Sternberger to Leeser and is writing to him for a second time “forwarding an introduction from Mr. Jonas of Jamaica", with hopes of visiting Philadelphia

Leeser, Isaac and Leo, Simeon N. New York, NY, A signed letter from Simeon N. Leo to Isaac leeser, sending a ticket to their fund raiser at Niblos Saloon for an association to raise funds to erect an asylum for the aged and infirmed of the Jewish persuasion. He also requests a free ad in the Occident

Leeser, Isaac and Leon, Theodore. New Orleans, LA, A letter written by Theodore Leon of New Orleans to Isaac Leeser Esq, Editor of the Occident. He asks that Leeser discontinue sending the Occident to Edward Leon, since he has moved to Europe

Leeser, Isaac and Leopold, Lewis F. Mackinaw Island, MI, A letter from Lewis F. Leopold on Mackinac Island, Michigan to Isaac Leeser. In this letter, Leopold submits a letter donation to Jerusalem and wishes Leeser well on bringing up the educational standards of Jewish youth. Additionally, he sends funds to extend his subscription to the Occident
Leeser, Isaac and Levi, P. New York, NY, A signed letter from P. Levi to Isaac Leeser, asking for the return of some letters he had sent to Leeser
Leeser, Isaac and Levi, Solomon L. Clear Spring, MD, A letter from Solomon L. Levi to Isaac Leeser, sending money for a one year subscription to the Occident and a bound copy of the Enlgish Bible

Leeser, Isaac and Levin, Nathaniel. Charleston, SC, A letter from Nathaniel Levin of Beth Elohim in Charleston, South Carolina to Isaac Leeser, forwarding "A charity sermon delivered by Rev. Solomon Jacobs on behalf of the sick and indigent." Levin asks that it be printed.In the letter he also speaks of affecting a reunion with the reformed

Leeser, Isaac and Levin, S. Syracuse, NY, A letter from S. Levin to Isaac Leeser, containing a progress report of the the Cheneseth Shalom synagogue in Syracuse, New York, which Leeser had consecrated a month prior. The letter relates in detail that things are going well

Leeser, Isaac and Levingston, Levi H. Bethania, NC, A letter from Levi H. Levingston in Bethania, North Carolina to Isaac Leeser. The letter is a fine example of an educated lay person from the rural hinterlands of America turning to Leeser with questions in depth on certain Biblical passages and interpretations. He also thanks Leeser for the books that he had ordered
Leeser, Isaac and Levinson, H. Houston, TX, Signed letter from H. Levinson from the firm of Harmam and Levinson in Texas to Isaac Leeser, ordering Occidents

Leeser, Isaac and Levy, Esther. Philadelphia, PA, A letter from Esther Levy, Matron of the Jewish Foster Home in Philadelphia, to Isaac Leeser, asking for the loan of a prayer book for the high holidays

Leeser, Isaac and Levy, R. A. Tioga Center, NY, A letter written by R. A. Levy in Tioga Center, New York to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia, expressing his opposition to the war, and referencing other anti-war conversations he has had with Leeser
Leeser, Isaac and Lewis, Abraham. Cinncinati, OH, Critical response to an article published in the Occident

Leeser, Isaac and Lilienthal, D. New York, NY, A letter from David Lilienthal in New York City to Isaac Leeser. The letter is written in German and notes that the sermon which he delivered in Augusta which his brother translated has been sent under a separate cover

Leeser, Isaac and Lilienthal, D. New York, NY, A letter from Rabbi David Lilienthal in New York City to Isaac Leeser, introducing him to Mr. Schwess, a teacher of the German and French languages. Lilienthal asks that Leeser recommend him

Leeser, Isaac and Lilienthall, D. New York, NY, A letter from Rabbi David Lilienthal in New York City to Isaac Leeser, asking him to help find a position for Dr. Zimmerman as a teacher, as he did for Dr. Schwess in Philadelphia
Leeser, Isaac and Lindo, Moses. Curacao, A letter from Moses Lindo to Isaac Leeser, regarding his selling of prayer books and Occidents for Leeser, and wishing him well on the high holidays

Leeser, Isaac and Lobo, David. St. Thomas, Virgin Islands, A letter from David Lobo in St. Thomas, Virgin Islands to Isaac Leeser, in which he informs Leeser of the of the circumcision of Benjamin Franklin Hendriques. As an aside, he lists the books he requires

Leeser, Isaac and Lowenthal, H. La Fayette, IN, A four page letter from H. Lowenthal in La Fayette, Indiana to Isaac Leeser, asking him a series of philosophical, theological, fundamental questions pertaining toritual slaughter. He is very anxious to receive a prompt reply from Leeser

Leeser, Isaac and Lowenthal, H. Macon, GA, A letter from Rev. Henry Lowenthal in Macon, Georgia to Isaac Leeser. In the letter he deals with the difficulties he is having with his congregation at Kahal Kadosh Beth Israel and how poorly they treat him. He concludes with the statement that he is looking for another position

Leeser, Isaac and Lyon, Robert. New York, NY, A letter from Robert Lyon of New York City, the publisher of the Asmonean (a weekly publication in English) to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia. Lyon is requesting Leeser to place an ad for the Asmonean in the Occident

Leeser, Isaac and Lyon, Robert. New York, NY, A letter from Robert Lyon of New York City, the publisher of the Asmonean (a weekly publication in English) to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia. The subject of the letter is an editorial that was published in the Occident attacking Rabbi Wise and his Albany Congregation. It appears to have been attributed anonymously to Lyon's " Asmonean ". Lyon is asking Leeser to issue a statement absolving him of guilt

Leeser, Isaac and Lyons, Anna. Philadelphia, PA, A letter from Anna Lyons, treasurer of the Ladies' Hebrew Sewing Society, to Isaac Leeser. The letter is headed "In account with the Ladies' Hebrew Sewing Society" and includes a report for monies received and paid out from Oct., 1849 through Oct., 1850

Leeser, Isaac and Markwell, M. Berlin, WI, A letter from M. Markwell and Levi Lavenberg in Berlin, Wisconsin to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia. Markwell writes to pay for a subscription and Lavenberg writes to suspend his subscription

Leeser, Isaac and Markwell, M. Berlin, WI, A letter from M. Markwell in Berlin, Wisconsin to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia. The letter discusses how they struggle to keep the religion alive in their hostile county
Leeser, Isaac and Marralho, S. C. Barbados, A letter from J. C. Marralho to Isaac Leeser, submitting the minutes of the Barbados Congregation's Ladies Auxiliary on the founding of a Sunday School

Leeser, Isaac and Matilda Cohen. Philadelphia, PA, A signed letter from Matilda Cohen to Isaac Leeser, apologizing on behalf of the H.H.B. Society for not sending him a special invitation to their anniversary meeting

Leeser, Isaac and Mayer, A. L. Syracuse, NY, A letter written by Rabbi A.L. Mayer in Syracuse, New York to Isaac Leeser. It provides insight into the competition for Rabbis within the growing Jewish population in America. The letter is written in German and accompanied by a modern English translation

Leeser, Isaac and Mayer, A. L. Syracuse, NY, A two page letter written by Rabbi A.L. Mayer in Syracuse, New York to Isaac Leeser. Rabbi Mayer is writing on behalf of the National Commercial College and asks to place ads in the Occident

Leeser, Isaac and Mayer, I. M. . Cincinnati, OH, A two page letter from I. M. Mayer in Cincinnati to Isaac Leeser. He writes that he is now the chief teacher and preacher at bene Israel. He requests a subscription to the Occident and submits an article to the journal. The letter is written in German and accompanied by a modern English translation
Leeser, Isaac and Meyer, C. A. San Francisco, CA, A letter from C.A. Meyer to Isaac Leeser regarding books
Leeser, Isaac and Meyer, Cauffman. San Francisco, CA, A letter from Cauffman Meyer to Isaac Leeser, discussing his progress in searching for a Rabbi for Congregation Emanuel

Leeser, Isaac and Meyerfeld, Isabella. San Francisco, CA, Letter from Isabella Meyerfeld in San Francisco to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia. She expresses her personal feelings of goodwill, and discusses her husband and children

Leeser, Isaac and Mitchell, M. A. Philadelphia, PA, A letter from M.A. Mitchell, president of the United Hebrew Beneficient Society in Philadelphia, to Isaac Leeser, asking him not to make any more recommendations for charity, as the society was out of funds

Leeser, Isaac and Moise, R. C. Augusta, GA, A three page letter written by R. C. Moise of Charleston, South Carolina to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia. In this letter, R.C. Moise first takes Leeser to task for not responding to her many letters. She then writes about education and about her cousin's positive impression of Leeser

Leeser, Isaac and Morais, Sabato. Philadelphia, PA, In this two page letter, W. H. Williams writes to Rev. Sabato Morais, noting that he has drafted suggested resolution from Maimonides College, expressing grief on the death of Isaac Leeser. He ends with a P.S., saying that he showed them to Rev. Bettleheim and Mr. Buttenweiss. On the reverse, Rev. Morais writes a completely rewritten beautiful expression of grief to be published by Maimonides College

Leeser, Isaac and Mordecai, B. Charleston, SC, A printed broadside from B. Mordecai of Charleston, South Carolina, addressed to Isaac Leeser, asking for a background check on Esther Davidson, who has applied to be a governess for the Mordechai children

Leeser, Isaac and Mordecai, M. C. Charleston, SC, A letter from Moses Cohen Mordecai in Charleston, South Carolina to Isaac Leeser, responding to a personal request by Leeser that he grant a $300/year allowance to Miss Reinah Judah, the unmarried cousin of David Judah, and kinswoman of the Mordecai's in Charleston. In this letter, Mordecai turns the request down, saying that he has his own sisters to support, and that David Judah, as a single man, should be able to support her

Leeser, Isaac and Morrison, Joseph. New York, NY, A letter from Joseph Morrison in New York to Isaac Leeser, in which Morrison starts off criticizing Leeser for bad handwriting and causing him to miss an arranged meeting. In the body of the letter he offers his apologies to Leeser for an article that he wrote for the Jewish periodical "Asmonean," which he wrote to defend Leeser's attempt to procure funds "for the destitute in New Orleans," but which was recieved differently by the public

Leeser, Isaac and Moses, Rose I. Columbus, GA, A letter from Rose I Moses in Columbus, Georgia to Isaac Leeser, sending him a notice about her Sabbath school, for which she was secretary. She orders multiple copies of three different Hebrew books and asks to be advised of a fund Leeser is raising

Leeser, Isaac and Myer, Henry. St. Louis, MO, A letter from Henry Myer, as Secretary of the United Sheba Congregation of St. Louis, Missouri, to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia. He writes of the High Holiday proceedings and extols the virtues of their new Hazan, Nathan Davidson

Leeser, Isaac and Myer, J. Montgomery, AL, A signed letter from J. Meyer in Montgomery, Alabama to Isaac Leeser, informing him of the election of officers and the rental of a synagogue in Mobile. The letter is also signed by Emanuel Lehman as secretary
Leeser, Isaac and Myers, G. Montgomery, AL, A signed letter from G. Meyer to Isaac Leeser about a subscription

Leeser, Isaac and Myers, M. Kingston, Jamacia, A letter from M. Myers in Kingston, Jamaica to rev. Isaac Leeser, lamenting the personal attacks on Leeser and commenting on Rev. De Sola, Rabbi I.M. Isaacs and Mr. Piza

Leeser, Isaac and Nathan, Moses N. Kingston, Jamacia, A letter from M.N. Nathan from Kingston, Jamaica to Isaac Leeser, conveying the news of the death of his sister's husband and sending his regards to Rebecca Gratz

Leeser, Isaac and Nathan, Moses N. Kingston, Jamaica, A highly detailed twelve page letter written by Rev. Moses N. Nathan, writing from Kingston, Jamaica, to Rev. Isaac Lesser in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. It is a detailed account of the interworking of the Curacao Synagogue in the early 1860’s. He also writes as to the deliberations on a proposed job offer from St. Thomas, Virgin Islands

scopecontent.p: LSKAP0040_1R.tif; LSKAP0040_1V.tif; LSKAP0040_2R.tif; LSKAP0040_2V.tif; LSKAP0040_3R.tif; LSKAP0040_3V.tif

did.unittitle: Leeser, Isaac and Nathan, Moses N. Kingston, Jamaica, A letter written by Rev. Moses N. Nathan from Kingston, Jamaica to Rev. Isaac Lesser in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. In this Civil War era letter, Nathan writes of slavery and the war

Leeser, Isaac and Nathan, Moses N. Kingston, Jamaica, A six page letter written by Rabbi Moses Nathan from Kingston, Jamaica to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. Nathan writes to Leeser on numerous subjects including the Civil War, the state of Jewry in New Orleans., his new pulpit in St. Thomas, issues with Joseph Abraham in Cincinnati and the lack of a Jewish boarding school in Britain

scopecontent.p: LSKAP0045_1R.tif; LSKAP0045_1V.tif; LSKAP0045_2R.tif; LSKAP0045_2V.tif; LSKAP0045_3R.tif; LSKAP0045_3V.tif

did.unittitle: Leeser, Isaac and Nathan, Moses N. New Orleans, LA, A four page letter written by Rev. Moses N. Nathan from New Orleans, Louisiana to Rev. Isaac Lesser in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. It is an historically important account of the difficulties mid-19th century Orthox Rabbi's were having in the American Congregations that were in a state of flux between traditional and reform thought. He tells Lesser that he is leaving his position at "The Dispersed of Judah"

Leeser, Isaac and Nathan, Moses N. New Orleans, LA, A handwritten sermon by Moses N. Nathan, written only days after he had joined his new congregation in New Orleans, sent to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia. Called upon to dedicate their new building, the sermon seeks Gods blessings on the consecration of the new synagogue and its members

Leeser, Isaac and Nathan, Moses N. New Orleans, LA, A three page letter, written by Rabbi Moses N. Nathan and Gershom Kursheedt to Isaac Leeser. In this letter they have forwarded for K.K. Beni Israel's contract with Rabbi Nathan. Then, Rabbi Nathan expresses the "city's " indignation at the treatment of Leeser by Mikveh Israel and he gives him advice. Lastly, Kursheedt, while verifying that the contract is correct, expresses his views of Leeser's departure from Mikveh Israel

Leeser, Isaac and Nathan, Moses N. St. Thomas, Virgin Islands, A highly detailed six page letter written by Rev. Moses N. Nathan from St. Thomas, Virgin Islands to Rev. Isaac Lesser in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. The letter deals with three themes. The first is that his wife is an invalid and he is working day and night to make certain she is cared for when he is gone. The second is an important Rabbinic debate with Leeser on trainng for a young man before Bar Mitzvah. The last deals with the difficulties of trying to compromise with the Reform ideas on the Island

Leeser, Isaac and Nathan, Moses N. St. Thomas, Virgin Islands, A letter written by Rev. Moses N. Nathan from St. Thomas, Virgin Islands to Rev. Isaac Lesser in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. This detailed letter, written while he was Hazan of the St. Thomas Congregation, describes the details of his services and asks how Leeser's plan for a college in Philadelphia is progressing

Leeser, Isaac and O'Neal, John Belton. Springfield, SC, A one and a half page letter from John Belton O'Neal, Chief Justice of the South Carolina Court, written to Isaac Leeser in Philadelphia as Editor of the Occident. The letter defends his statement in a case in which it was thought a Jew had been slandered by the City Council of Charleston

Leeser, Isaac and Oppenheim, E. Pottsville, PA, A four page letter written by E. Oppenheim of Pottsville, Pennsylvania to Isaac Leeser of Philadelphia. He notes that the congregation is doing well in Pottsville thanks to Mr. Greewald as President and Silas Strause as Vice President. The letter is in German with a full transcription
Leeser, Isaac and Peixotto, A. J. Kingston, Jamacia, A one page letter to Rabbi Isaac Lesser from A. C. Peixotto in Kingston, Jamaica, discussing the sale of Leeser's books

Leeser, Isaac and Peixotto, B. F. Cleveland, OH, A letter from B. F. Peixotto in Cleveland, Ohio to Isaac Leeser regarding Bnai Brith and lodge donations. It is on his firm's stationary "Davis, Peixotto and Co."

Leeser, Isaac and Peixotto, Benjamin Franklin.Philadelphia, PA, This is a note from Isaac Leeser's papers, the instructions as to when he is to respond to a toast at a banquet in honor of Benjamin Franklin Peixotto, Grand Master of the Order in the United States, Grand Saar of the I.O.B.B

Leeser, Isaac and Plant, L. M. Evansville, IN, A letter from L. M. Plant in Evansville, Indiana to Isaac Leeser, asking Leeser to insert an ad asking for donations to help him builf the first synagogue in Evansville

Leeser, Isaac and Pleasants, T. S. Beaver Dam, VA, A letter from T. S. Pleasants, a Quaker in Beaverdam, Virginia to Isaac Leeser. This letter contains a continued dialogue on religious similarities and differences

Leeser, Isaac and Putzel, Michael. Easton, PA, A group of three letters from Michael Putzel to Isaac Leeser. The first is in german, asking for a recommendation for a haza, Schochet, teacher, and preacher at the German kehilla in Philadelphia. The second asks Leeser to act as agent on behalf of the Easton, Pennsylvania congregation and approach Mrs. Hart to give the deed to the old cemetery to the congregation. The third is a request to put a note inthe Occident
